keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

headline.print_headline: The Sticks and Carrots of Wellness Programs
headline.main: The Sticks and Carrots of Employee Wellness Programs

snippet: Some companies offer incentives for sharing medical data and undertaking health-improvement regimens. Others impose penalties for not doing that. Either way, the programs raise troubling questions.
abstract: Tara Siegel Bernard Your Money column examines wellness programs; motivation structures for plans seem sound, but critics contend they move more health insurance costs onto employees and potentially discriminate against less healthy workers by compelling them to pay more.
lead_paragraph: Some companies offer incentives for sharing medical data and undertaking health-improvement regimens. Others impose penalties for not doing that. Either way, the programs raise troubling questions.
